entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 10:37PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN FOR LATE WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND FOR GULF COAST AND ICY STRAIT CORRIDOR... An atmospheric river has been giving moderate to heavy rain to parts of the northern half of Southeast Alaska. Heavy rain started late Wednesday night near Yakutat, and is expected to slide over the Icy Strait corridor and central gulf coast on Friday. So far, the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 2:17PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Northern Inner Channel rivers and streams rising to near bankfull Saturday... Heavy rain from the Atmospheric River moving into the Northern Inner Channels will cause many area rivers and streams to rapidly rise to near bankfull late Friday night into Saturday. Flooding potential remains low, but any substantial changes in rainfall could result in
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.cap:areaDesc: Humboldt County; Northern Elko County
